intro: Paeonia microcarpa, commonly known as the Chinese peony or the small-fruited peony, is a deciduous shrub native to China. It is characterized by its broad, ovate leaves and clusters of fragrant, showy flowers that range in color from white to deep pink. The plant produces small, round berries that contain seeds, which are dispersed by birds. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular ornamental plant in gardens. Paeonia microcarpa is also valued for its medicinal properties in traditional Chinese medicine.
